visualization.description: Module used to map simulation data (per particlle values) to a range of 0 to 1 for rendering.
visualization.name: Visualizer

render_clamp.name: Describes a clipping plane for the simulaltion relative to the simulations AABB used for rendering. Negative values flip what side is clipped. Useful value: {0.f,0.f,0.f}.

camera_position.name: Camera position in world coordinates. Useful value: {125 0 -50}

camera_angle.name: Angle of the camera (based on houdinis representation of cameras). Useful value: {-90 0 90}.

camera_resolution.name: Resolution of the render window. Currently not used.

camera_fps.name: FPS target for the export from the openGL viewport into a file.

gl_file.name: File the openGL viewport should be rendered into.

min.name: Represents the lower boundary of the color mapping. Useful values depend on what is being visualized.

max.name: Represents the upper boundary of the color mapping. Useful values depend on what is being visualized.

auto.name: Used to enable/disable automatically scaling the visualization range to the full input range.

map_flipped.name: Used to enable/disable automatically scaling the visualization range to the full input range.

buffer.name: Contains the name of the array that should be visualized, e.g. density.

map.name: Path to a file that contains the color map used for visualization.
